choiceresponse.p: We often get questions about which types of work count as Core Contributor work. There is admittedly a blurry line at times, but often it is very clear. Review "Finding Meaningful Work" as a refresher.
choiceresponse.label: Which of the following would count as valid Core Contributor hours?

choice.div: Doing prep work for a Working Group meeting
Attending a Working Group meeting, or catching up on a meeting (via recording or notes) if you can't attend synchronously
Performing follow-up work from a Working Group meeting
Working on projects for my company's client
Meetings within my company's team about projects our company is working on
Answering questions on the Open edX forums
Giving a talk to my team
Recording a talk on a topic relevant to some part of the community, and posting it for the greater community to see
1-1/synchronous collaboration time with other community members on work you're doing together

Working on a design, strategy, or other program that benefits the Open edX project but is not work that falls under my Core Contributor role (for example, working on translating the platform when you're a Product Manager)
Using the knowledge or contacts I've gained through my Core Contributor role to try to gain new clients for my company
